intro: Santiria minimiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered santiria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth, glossy surface.
